complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Set up app shell with Tailwind CSS
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: No expansion needed - straightforward HTML boilerplate creation with CDN integration.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Basic HTML file creation with standard meta tags, Tailwind CDN, and single script import. No logic, state management, or external dependencies. Purely structural with manual verification testing.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: No expansion needed - single class implementation with standard hashchange event handling and basic route mapping.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Simple class-based router with event listener, basic path matching, and DOM manipulation. Low cyclomatic complexity (few decision points), standard browser API usage, dependency on task 16.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: No expansion needed - single component with DOM creation and single event dispatch.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Straightforward class with render method creating static DOM elements and dispatching custom event. Minimal logic, Tailwind styling, depends on router from task 17.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Create DOM structure and styling, 2) Implement toggle/open-close functionality, 3) Add message rendering methods.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Complex DOM construction with responsive design (mobile/desktop), multiple sub-components (header, messages, input), event handling, and state management. Higher cognitive complexity due to nested element creation and responsive Tailwind classes.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Serverless function setup and input validation, 2) Anthropic SDK streaming integration with SSE, 3) Error handling and timeout management.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Serverless Edge runtime with streaming SSE, external Anthropic SDK integration, async generators, TransformStream handling, error boundaries, and environment variable management. High complexity due to streaming protocols and third-party API orchestration.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Connect ChatWidget to API with streaming
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Implement sendMessage API integration, 2) SSE stream parsing and real-time UI updates, 3) Error handling and state synchronization.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Complex async fetch with ReadableStream parsing, real-time DOM updates during streaming, message state management, error recovery, and UI synchronization. High cyclomatic complexity from stream processing loops and error conditions.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Create storage utility module, 2) Integrate load/save into ChatWidget lifecycle.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Utility module creation plus ChatWidget integration with load-on-init, save-on-send, and render-on-toggle logic. Moderate complexity from state hydration and error handling, but standard localStorage patterns.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Add mobile responsiveness to chat widget
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Update container classes for responsive behavior, 2) Implement resize event handling and body class management.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: CSS class updates for Tailwind responsive design plus resize event listener and dynamic body class manipulation. Moderate complexity from viewport breakpoint logic and keyboard handling considerations.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Create centralized ErrorHandler utility, 2) Integrate error boundaries across ChatWidget and API endpoint.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Centralized error utility plus integration across multiple components (ChatWidget, storage, API). Involves error classification, user-facing messages, timeouts, and recovery patterns.

complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break into: 1) Create test utilities and health-check endpoint, 2) Execute cross-browser/device testing, 3) Document results and create validation report.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Comprehensive testing across functional, responsive, error, and performance dimensions. Multiple environments (browsers, devices), test utility implementation, and documentation. High coordination complexity despite individual tests being simple.
